Pre-Game Insights: Canada has a chance to shut down Pakistan's World Cup campaign
Pakistan may have time to process their heartache after the defeat against India
Canada, if not for an Aaron Jones blitz in the opening game of this tournament, would have been coming into this contest with two wins in two games
Canada demonstrated in the second game the quality of the bowling line-up to squeeze Ireland effectively in defence of 137
Add to that a superb fielding performance, and this is a side that has shown it has both the hunger and the ability to trouble most in group A

If in the first game, Canada showed they have the batters right down the order to put on huge scores, they demonstrated in the second the quality of the bowling line-up to squeeze Ireland effectively in defence of 137

Canada will be thankful for 26-year-old Barbados-born Nicholas Kirton not being scooped up by West Indies, because at this tournament, he has shown the personality and quality to perform on the big stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is being played in New York
Rain delayed the start of the India-Pakistan clash in New York, but no weather interruptions are expected on Tuesday
A fresh pitch is expected to be used for the Canada-Pakistan clash
Others: Pakistan lost their first two games at a T20 World Cup came in 2022. They have never lost their opening three games
Only three players have scored more runs than Kirton's 100 at this T20 World Cup. Pakistan's highest scorer is Babar, well behind with 57
